text: If you have a positive attitude and constantly strive to give your best effort, eventually you will overcome your immediate problems and find you are ready for greater challenges.

text: Excellence is the gradual result of always striving to do better.

text: You have no choices about how you lose, but you do have a choice about how you come back and prepare to win again.

text: It's what you get from games you lose that is extremely important.

text: The true warrior understands and seizes that moment by giving an effort so intense and so intuitive that it could only be called one from the heart.

text: A champion needs a motivation above and beyond winning.
author: Pat Riley

text: In all the research you do as a coach, studying other coaches and championship-type situations, you find that all those teams combined talent with great defense. You've got to stop other teams to win.
author: Pat Riley

text: When a great team loses through complacency, it will constantly search for new and more intricate explanations to explain away defeat.
author: Pat Riley

text: Great teamwork is the only way we create the breakthroughs that define our careers.
author: Pat Riley

text: The key to teamwork is to learn a role, accept a role, and strive to become excellent playing it.
author: Pat Riley

text: When a milestone is conquered, the subtle erosion called entitlement begins its consuming grind. The team regards its greatness as a trait and a right. Half hearted effort becomes habit and saps a champion.
author: Pat Riley

text: Management must speak with one voice. When it doesn't management itself becomes a peripheral opponent to the team's mission.
author: Pat Riley

text: If you're not getting better, you're getting worse.
author: Pat Riley

text: Teamwork requires that everyone's efforts flow in a single direction. Feelings of significance happen when a team's energy takes on a life of its own.
author: Pat Riley

text: Coaches who let a championship team back off from becoming a dynasty are cowards.
author: Pat Riley

text: All of us have at least one great voice deep inside.
author: Pat Riley

text: The key to success is to learn to do something right and then do it right every time.
author: Pat Riley

text: Great players and great teams want to be driven. They want to be pushed to the edge. They don't want to be cheated.
author: Pat Riley

text: Being ready isn't enough; you have to be prepared for a promotion or any other significant change.

text: When you face a fork in the road, step on the exhilarator!

text: Great effort springs naturally from great attitude.

text: After a grand victory in a grand war, the hardest battle to fight is the first little skirmish of the next campaign.
